com.epoch
Class HWSet

java.lang.Object
  com.epoch.HWSet
All Implemented Interfaces:
HWSetConstants
public class HWSet
extends Object
implements HWSetConstants

Holds the questions of an assignment created by an instructor. Sessions: HWCreateSession.

Field Detail

id

private final int id
ID number of this assignment within this course. Not the same as a serial number.

externalId

public int externalId
ID number of this assignment; unique among all assignments.

name

public String name
Name of the assignment.

creationDate

public Date creationDate
Creation date of the assignment.

dueDate

public Date dueDate
Due date of the assignment. May be altered for individual students by extensions.

courseId

public int courseId
ID number of the course in which this assignment resides.

totalPoints

public float totalPoints
Total number of points this assignment is worth; same as number of questions.

extensionees

public String extensionees
Students who have extensions, and the length of the extensions. Format is /ID/int/ID/int... where ID is the login (UK) or SMS (Pearson) ID of the student. Length is usually measured in days but for exams is measured in minutes. Length must be integral.

attemptGrading

public String attemptGrading
Attempt-dependent grading parameters. Have format x1/y1/x2/y2/...//yn, where x represents the number of attempts and y is a multiplier. E.g., 2/1.0/5/0.8//0.5 reads, "Up to 2 attempts, multiply the grade by 1.0; more than 2 and up to 5, multiply it by 0.8; more than 5, multiply it by 0.5."

timeGrading

public String timeGrading
Time-dependent grading parameters for assignments that have been modified after the due date has passed. Have format x1/y1/x2/y2/...//yn, where x represents the number of attempts and y is a multiplier. E.g., 2/1.0/5/0.8//0.5 reads, "Up to 2 days past the due date, multiply the grade by 1.0; more than 2 and up to 5 days late, multiply it by 0.8; more than 5 days late, multiply it by 0.5."

flags

public int flags
Flags for student visibility, recording after the due date, and whether the assignment is an exam.

qList

public ArrayList<ArrayList<Question>> qList
A list of lists of Questions. Each fixed question in an assignment corresponds to a question list containing one member. If an assignment has a group of random questions, a question list will contain more than one question, and ACE will choose a certain number (stored in randomPicks) of those questions when it instantiates an assignment for a particular user. The list of lists represents the questions used in an assignment, whether random or not.

randomPicks

public ArrayList<Integer> randomPicks
How many questions to choose randomly from each list of questions in qList. For fixed questions, value is 1.

fixedSetIds

public ArrayList<Integer> fixedSetIds
Unique IDs of questions that all students will see.

fixedSetQSetIds

public ArrayList<Integer> fixedSetQSetIds
Unique IDs of question sets containing questions that all students will see.

Parameters:

Returns:

getExtension

public double getExtension(String userId)
Gets the number of days or minutes in extension of a user.

Parameters:
userId - login (UK) or SMS (Pearson) ID of the user working on this assignment
Returns:
length of extension of a user; 0 if user is not found in extensionees, INDEFINITE if no number is found after userId

                                  String extensionees)
Gets the number of days or minutes in extension of a user.

Parameters:
userId - login (UK) or SMS (Pearson) ID of the user working on this assignment
extensionees - string describing which students have what extensions
Returns:
length of extension of a user; 0 if user is not found in extensionees, INDEFINITE if no number is found after userId

getDueDate

public static Calendar getDueDate(String userId,
                                  String extensionees,
                                  Date dueDate,
                                  boolean isExam)
Gets the due date plus the extension for a user.

Parameters:
userId - login (UK) or SMS (Pearson) ID of the user working on this assignment
extensionees - students who have extensions, and the length of the extensions
dueDate - due date before the extension has been applied
isExam - whether this assignment is an exam, i.e. whether extensions are measured in minutes or days
Returns:
due date + extension; null if extension < 0

Parameters:
dueDate - due date before the extension has been applied
extension - number of days or minutes in this user's extension
isExam - whether this assignment is an exam, i.e. whether extensions are measured in minutes or days
Returns:
due date + extension; null if extension < 0
